channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bin men not doing their job, 22nd October
item.description:
I have placed in this address temporarily and have been here almost 3 weeks now. Explain why the bin men are taking everyone else's recyclables and rubbish, and not ours? I am sick of this now! I stopped them in person last weel and they told me it doesnt matter which bin I put things in, they will take it. And they haven't AGAIN. I will be fly tipping my rubbish if this isnt rectified.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waratah Drive, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inappropriate Parking Location, 22nd October
item.description:
The section of road immediately in front of 27 Thistlefield Cl is not long enough to safely park a vehicle. Despite this, it is regularly used for parking which obstructs either or both of the driveways on either side of it - something I understand to be an offence according to the highway code. When cars are parked here it causes an obstruction on the street for larger vans or lorries (including garbage collection vehicles) who cannot easily or safely pass. It also causes obstruction to the residents of 25, 26, 27, 28 and 29 Thistlefield Cl who have allocated parking here as well as visitors or delivery vehicles to this area. Recently, a lorry hit a car parked in this section of road when trying to exit the parking area/driveway, because a car was parked part way across the driveway and the lorry could not make a complete turn left out of the driveway. This section of road should be marked with double yellow lines to maintain safe access and egress both to the rest of Thistlefield Close and the driveways and allocated parking surrounding it. Alternatively, wardens should patrol this area more frequently to deter the recent increase of inappropriate parking here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Thistlefield Close, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights at Junction between Agar Grove and Murray Street and Zebra Crossing lights outside NISA store STILL not working!, 22nd October
item.description:
This is the 5th time I need to write about this issue which still persists despite my numerous attempts asking the council to take action! The council closed my previous issue here stating that the works required to fix the street and zebra crossing lights are complete. UKPN carried out some works in the area to re-instate power to the street lights two weeks ago. However, one of street lights in the area does not work, and 2 poles still need to have the arms and lanterns installed (which is the council's responsibility) so they are not working either. As a result, we still don't have proper street lights in the area, despite the fact that the bridge replacement works were completed more than 3 months ago now. BAM(who did the bridge replacement works) still has the metal fences with temporary street lights affixed to them. This is not a solution!!!! Please complete the works to re-instate our street lights, install the arms and lanterns required to the two poles on the bridge and ask BAM to remove those metal fences. This has been going on for 3 months now since the bridge works were completed and it makes no sense that we still don't have proper street lights in the area because of this inertia. Two of the street line poles are currently without lanterns and do not work. BAM has clearly stated that this is the councils responsibility! Furthermore, the zebra crossing lights are not working either. This is a potential hazard as you can understand. Please sort this out ASAP as its not safe to not have proper street lights around the agar grove bridge area and we want those metal fences left over by BAM removed!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Agar Grove, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
